cleaned_text: Health: Your official portal to public health services, hospitals, health information and health careers in South Australia Special vaccination requirements Although vaccination is safe for the vast majority of people there are some people who, for various reasons, may not be able to be vaccinated or who may not be able to receive certain vaccines, for example allergies or current health status, or may need additional vaccines. It is important to discuss risks or side effects of vaccination with a health care professional before being immunised. Talk to your doctor before being vaccinated if you: - are [pregnant, breastfeeding or planning a pregnancy](/wps/wcm/connect/public+content/sa+health+internet/conditions/immunisation/pregnancy+and+immunisation) - have previously had a serious adverse event following immunisation, or - have a [medical condition or are undergoing treatment that places you at increased risk](https://www.health.gov.au/topics/immunisation/when-to-get-vaccinated/immunisation-for-people-with-medical-risk-conditions)of some vaccine preventable diseases - identify as [Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander](/wps/wcm/connect/public+content/sa+health+internet/conditions/immunisation/aboriginal+immunisation+recommendations/aboriginal+immunisation+recommendations).
